definitions.definition: Continuously , constantly , all the time ( for the complete duration ) .
examples: People struggled to cope with the ever -increasing cost of living.
We've only ever talked on the phone.
I scarcely ever see you anymore!.
If that ever happens, we’re in deep trouble.
This is one of the best movies ever .
He's back and better than ever .
I’ll stop your ever doing that again.

definitions.definition: As intensifier following an interrogative word.
examples: Was I ever glad to see you!

definitions.definition: Indicates experiential aspect , once ; has or have (done something) before.

main_definition: ( formal or archaic ) Always , frequently , forever .
secondary_definitions: Continuously , constantly , all the time ( for the complete duration ) .
( informal ) As intensifier following an interrogative word.
( Manglish , Singlish ) Indicates experiential aspect , once ; has or have (done something) before.
